issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: I suspect that some of Sean's problems with pushing a release have to do with the staleness of the versions of various critical plugins, such as the maven release plugin. Under this JIRA, I propose to move everything up to current released versions. As a side-benefit, parallel builds under maven 3 should become possible.
fields.summary: Update plugin versions in the POM structure

comments.body: It would be good if some other people would try this out.

author.name: tdunning
author.emailAddress: ted dot dunning at gmail dot com

comments.body:
+1.

I have been using the parallel build stuff for a bit and it actually works under maven 2.

But upgrading the different versions is a great idea.

updateAuthor.name: tdunning
updateAuthor.emailAddress: ted dot dunning at gmail dot com

author.name: drew.farris
author.emailAddress: drew dot farris at gmail dot com

comments.body:
I'm running into the following problem when building via 'mvn -e clean install' with this patch applied. Looks like we could be hitting http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/SUREFIRE-640. As the issue suggests changing redirectTestOutputToFile to false resolves the issue. Generally I prefer to keep the output redirected to a file  It is easier to troubleshoot unit test issues if the output is preserved in one file per test instead of having the explicitly capture the output of the entire maven build. Perhaps we should consider rolling back to an earlier version of the surefire plugin?

comments.body: Verified that either downgrading to 2.5 or setting redirectTestOutputToFile to false resolve this issue, I'd prefer the former. Anyone else care?

comments.body: I like the separate output files as well so I would vote for downgrading.

comments.body:
The mahout-math jar appears to be in *-job.jar

There seems to be some redundancy in directory structure in the distribution/target directory:
{code}
$ pwd
distribution/target/mahout-distribution-0.5-SNAPSHOT/mahout-distribution-0.5-SNAPSHOT
$
{code}
Since the actual artifacts look pretty good, I assume that this is not important.

updateAuthor.name: tdunning
updateAuthor.emailAddress: ted dot dunning at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Integrated in Mahout-Quality #425 (See [https://hudson.apache.org/hudson/job/Mahout-Quality/425/])
    MAHOUT-532: update poms to resolve warnings from M3 and take relatively current plugin versions
